intro: Lessertia tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lessertia, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in forested areas and along stream banks. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in partial shade and well-drained soil.
